* Zyber looked up at Rowdy as he exited the cave, she then continued to wash 
her shoulder until he mentioned the fact that something didn't smell right.
She turned her head towards the opening and sniffed carefully, with absolute 
concentration she was able to pick up the extremely fain sent of something 
strange.
Suddenly her scanners flickered and showed the same signature that she had 
detected earlier but had dismissed, except this time it didn't disappear!
Zyber located the signature and stood up, she moved up silently up beside 
Rowdy, almost as mysterious as a sudden fog.
She silently sniffed the air and then put her nose to the ground, a trick 
that she had learned when tracking game.
She put all of her attention on her nose as she pressed it to the ground, 
she felt slight and weak vibrations.
Judging by the way that the vibrations came to her she knew that whatever 
made them was weak and hurt, something that had benefitted her on the hunt.
Zyber lifter her head to the wind then and make a small sneeze, she pointer 
her snout south-east...*

" Whatever it is is coming towards us from that direction, it's weak and 
seems to he hurt."

* Zyber trotted out a few more feet and pressed her snout to the ground 
again, the vibrations were a little stronger but still showed that what ever 
made them was injured.
She then began to move off in the direction of the cause of the vibrations, 
once in a while stopping and pressing her snout to the ground.
She was getting closer!*

_________________________________________________________________

* Iron Raptor was now kneeling in a large puddle of her own mech-fluid, she 
continued to fire at Scavenger but occasionally fired off at Dark One.
Either target was good enough for her at the time.
She wads growing weak but even with the dying power supply she kept up a 
wicked defence, she couldn't let them pass.
Iron Raptor noticed that both Liono and Tigerhawk were both in the battle 
now but that didn't concern her, only the fact to get the Alliance away from 
the ship was what made her spark pound.*
